column4: Hey I'm trying to add my HP printer to ubuntu 9.10 and i have installed the drivers and what not, but when it says to actually "add" the printer, the program isn't detecting the printer. (HP PSC 1401 All-in-one)
USB or network?
USB
the program being the HP device manager :|
does the printer show up in lshw or dmesg when you connect it?
I remember seeing a little message box pop up when i re-connected it.
is that what you mean?
sorry I'm new to Linux, after a life of XP im trying to learn this
what did the message box say?  Use paste.ubuntu.com to paste it if it is long
it was like a notification, it came and went a little quick but i think all it said was basically the system recognizes it, but when i go to the device manager to actually add it, it doesn't show
I've tried disconnecting and re-connecting to see if it comes up again and it hasn't
so there is nothing in System -> Administrationr -> Printing?
there is. ( PSC-1401-series, and PSC-1401-Series 2)
Right click on each of them, select Properties, and then click Print Test Page.  I have a feeling one will work.
yes the one labled series 2 worked
Glad to hear it!  Ubuntu is a lot easier than Windows in that regard sometimes, because it can auto-install many drivers from open-source repositories
so I've heard, its got a lot of fun stuff too :D but now i need the scanner to work on it. because i kinda need that more than the actual printer;;
Scanner should be similar.  Plug it in, then try running Applications -> Graphics -> XSane Image Scanner
its a combo with the printer, and when i just attempted, it said no devices found.
"No Devices Avaliable"
I'm not particularly knowledgeable with scanners, but https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ScanningHowTo may have some good insights
Thanks
